course.subject: ECON
course.name: Public Economics
course.description: This course covers the economics of the public sector and how it interacts with the rest of the economy. Among the topics we will cover are: theories of optimal taxation and impact of taxes on economic activity; effects of taxes on resource allocation and welfare; theories of tax incidence; fiscal and equity implications of alternative tax schemes; the nature of public goods; theory of public expenditure; fiscal dynamics and growth; intergovernmental fiscal relations.
course.prerequisites: ECON 3014 OR ECON 3143

reviews.author: TCheung
reviews.title: Good grade but learning only a little
reviews.comment_content:
Very similar to several chapters in ECON3014. Basically two big topics:

1) Taxation and Redistribution
- Tax incidence
- Labour Income Taxes and Transfers
- Capital Income Taxation

2) Role of the government
- Externalities
- Public Goods
- Social Insurance
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very nice professor but with heavy Italian accent.

Not much interaction in class, maybe because of the small class size. (The possible reason for small class size is the time crash with ECON3024 and many other elective courses)

Usually, less than 10 people (sometimes only 5 - 6 people) would attend the lesson, so quite boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Probably because of the small class size (16 people), he could give a huge A range. I scored around the mean in the midterm, but still got an A.

Midterm (30%) - Mean: 77; SD: 12
One A4-double-sided cheat-sheet was allowed. In-class. There are 3 questions, but only the best 2 questions would be counted. The questions are very similar to those in the practice midterms.

The questions are very simple, but since I misread one of the questions, I scored 10/50 for that question even the other steps were correct. As well as you have done the practice midterm, "copy" the questions into the cheat-sheet, and look at the exam questions carefully, you should be able to score very high.

Final Exam (50%) - No statistics
Similar to midterm, one A4-double-sided cheat-sheet was allowed. There are 4 questions, and the best 3 questions would be counted. The questions were still very similar to those in the practice exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
The lightest workload course I have ever had. No attendance, no tutorial, no project, little homework, and even little revision required.

Homework (20%)
4 homework in total, 4 questions for each homework.

The TA was not marking the homework seriously. As well as you have submitted them on time, you should be able to get 9/10 or above for each homework.

Tutorial
No tutorial except one for midterm paper checking.
